questions.question: What is a set?
questions.explanation: A set is a well-defined collection of objects or elements.

questions.question: What does 'well-defined' mean in set theory?
questions.explanation: It must be clear whether an object belongs to the set or not.

questions.question: Which of the following forms a set?
questions.explanation: Vowels are clearly defined elements.

questions.question: Which collection does NOT form a set?
questions.explanation: Qualitative attributes alone do not form sets.

questions.question: What are elements of a set?
questions.explanation: Elements are the members contained in a set.

questions.question: Which property must elements of a set satisfy?
questions.explanation: Elements of a set must be distinct.

questions.question: What symbol means 'belongs to'?
questions.explanation: The symbol ‚àà means 'is a member of'.

questions.question: What does the symbol ‚àâ mean?
questions.explanation: ‚àâ means an element does not belong to a set.

questions.question: How are sets usually denoted?
questions.explanation: Sets are denoted by capital letters like A, B, C.

questions.question: How are elements usually denoted?
questions.explanation: Elements are denoted by lowercase letters or numbers.

questions.question: Which set represents natural numbers?
questions.explanation: N represents the set of natural numbers.

questions.question: Which symbol represents real numbers?
questions.explanation: R represents real numbers.

questions.question: Which of the following represents integers?
questions.explanation: Z (or I) represents integers.

questions.question: Which method lists all elements of a set?
questions.explanation: Roster method lists elements explicitly.

questions.question: Another name for the roster method is?
questions.explanation: Roster method is also called enumeration method.

questions.question: Which method describes sets using properties?
questions.explanation: Set-builder method uses defining properties.

questions.question: What symbol is used in set-builder notation to mean 'such that'?
questions.explanation: The colon (:) means 'such that'.

questions.question: Does the order of elements matter in a set?
questions.explanation: Order does not affect a set.

questions.question: Which sets are equal: {1,2,3} and {3,2,1}?
questions.explanation: They contain the same elements.

questions.question: What is the cardinality of a set?
questions.explanation: Cardinality is the number of elements in a set.

questions.question: If A = {1, 2, 3} and B = {3, 4, 5}, find A ‚à™ B.
questions.explanation: Union contains all distinct elements from both sets.

questions.question: If A = {a, b, c} and B = {c, d}, find A ‚à© B.
questions.explanation: Intersection contains common elements only.

questions.question: If A = {2, 4, 6, 8} and x = 5, which statement is correct?
questions.explanation: 5 is not an element of set A.

questions.question: Given A = {1, 2} and B = {1, 2, 3}, which is true?
questions.explanation: Every element of A is contained in B.

questions.question: How many elements are in the set {x | x is an even number less than 10}?
questions.explanation: The set is {2, 4, 6, 8}.

questions.question: If A = {1, 2, 3}, how many subsets does A have?
questions.explanation: Number of subsets = 2‚Åø = 2¬≥ = 8.

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a subset of A = {a, b, c}?
questions.explanation: Element d is not in A.

questions.question: If U = {1,2,3,4,5} and A = {1,3}, find A‚Ä≤.
questions.explanation: Complement contains elements in U but not in A.

questions.question: If A ‚à© B = ‚àÖ, the sets A and B are said to be?
questions.explanation: Disjoint sets have no elements in common.

questions.question: Which of the following is always a subset of any set?
questions.explanation: The empty set is a subset of every set.

questions.question: If n(A) = 5, what is the number of elements in P(A)?
questions.explanation: Power set has 2‚Åµ = 32 elements.

questions.question: If A = {1,2,3} and B = {3,4}, find A ‚àí B.
questions.explanation: Elements in A but not in B are {1,2}.

questions.question: If A ‚àí B = ‚àÖ, then which is true?
questions.explanation: All elements of A are in B.

questions.question: How many proper subsets does a set with 4 elements have?
questions.explanation: Proper subsets = 2‚Å¥ ‚àí 1 = 15 ‚àí 1 = 14.

questions.question: If A = {x | x < 5, x ‚àà N}, what is A?
questions.explanation: Natural numbers less than 5 are {1,2,3,4}.

questions.question: If n(U) = 20 and n(A) = 7, find n(A‚Ä≤).
Which of the following statements is TRUE?
questions.explanation: The empty set is a subset of itself.

questions.question: If A = {1,2} and B = {2,1}, then A and B are?
questions.explanation: Order does not matter in sets.

questions.question: If n(A) = 3 and n(B) = 4, what is the maximum value of n(A ‚à© B)?
questions.explanation: Maximum intersection equals the smaller set.

questions.question: Which formula is correct?
options: n(A ‚à™ B) = n(A) + n(B) ‚àí n(A ‚à© B)
questions.explanation: This is the inclusion‚Äìexclusion principle.

questions.question: If n(A) = 12, n(B) = 15 and n(A ‚à© B) = 5, find n(A ‚à™ B).
In a class of 40 students, 25 like Mathematics, 18 like Physics, and 10 like both. How many like neither?
If A ‚äÇ B and n(A) = 6, n(B) = 10, how many elements are in B ‚àí A?
questions.explanation: B ‚àí A = 10 ‚àí 6 = 4.

questions.question: If U = {1,2,3,4,5,6,7} and A = {2,4,6}, find A‚Ä≤ ‚à© {1,3,5}.
questions.explanation: A‚Ä≤ = {1,3,5,7}. Intersection gives {1,3,5}.

questions.question: If n(A) = 8, how many subsets of A contain exactly 3 elements?
questions.explanation: Number of subsets = C(8,3) = 56.

questions.question: If A ‚à© B = A, which statement is correct?
questions.explanation: All elements of A are in B.

questions.question: If n(U) = 50, n(A) = 28 and n(B) = 30, what is the minimum value of n(A ‚à™ B)?
questions.explanation: Minimum union occurs when overlap is maximum, limited by U.

questions.question: Which of the following is TRUE?
questions.explanation: Every proper subset is also a subset.

questions.question: If A = {1,2,3} and B = {2,3,4}, find (A ‚à™ B) ‚àí (A ‚à© B).
questions.explanation: Union = {1,2,3,4}, intersection = {2,3}.

questions.question: If n(A ‚à© B) = 0, then A and B are?
questions.explanation: Disjoint sets share no elements.

questions.question: How many elements are in the power set of the empty set?
questions.explanation: P(‚àÖ) = {‚àÖ}, so it has one element.

questions.question: If A has 5 elements, how many proper subsets does A have?
questions.explanation: Proper subsets = 2‚Åµ ‚àí 2 = 30.

questions.question: Which of the following sets is finite?
options: Set of months in a year
questions.explanation: There are exactly 12 months.

questions.question: If A = {x | x¬≤ = 4, x ‚àà Z}, find A.
questions.explanation: Both ‚àí2 and 2 satisfy the equation.

questions.question: If n(A ‚à™ B) = 18, n(A) = 10 and n(B) = 12, find n(A ‚à© B).
questions.explanation: 10 + 12 ‚àí x = 18 ‚áí x = 4? Wait correction: x = 4 ‚Üí mistake; correct is 10+12‚àíx=18 ‚Üí x=4? Actually 22‚àíx=18 ‚Üí x=4 ‚ùå correction: correctIndex should be 0.

questions.question: Which statement correctly describes a universal set?
questions.explanation: The universal set includes everything in the context.

questions.question: If A ‚äÇ B and B ‚äÇ C, then A ‚äÇ C. This property is called?
questions.explanation: Subset relation is transitive.

questions.question: If A = ‚àÖ, then P(A) is?
questions.explanation: The power set contains the empty set.

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT always true?
options: If A ‚äÇ B then A ‚äÜ B
questions.explanation: A cannot be a proper subset of itself.

questions.question: If n(A) = n(B) and A ‚äÜ B, then?
questions.explanation: Same size and subset implies equality.

questions.question: Which of the following best represents a Venn diagram?
questions.explanation: Venn diagrams show set relationships graphically.

questions.question: In a group of 60 students, 35 play football, 25 play basketball, and 10 play both. How many play only football?
questions.explanation: Only football = 35 ‚àí 10 = 25 ‚ùå correction: correctIndex should be 0.

questions.question: Which operation gives elements common to both sets?
questions.explanation: Intersection finds common elements.

questions.question: If A = {1,3,5} and B = {2,4,6}, then A ‚à™ B is?
questions.explanation: Union combines all elements.

questions.question: Which set operation removes common elements?
questions.explanation: Difference excludes shared elements.

questions.question: If A has 3 elements and B has 4 elements, what is the maximum possible size of A ‚à© B?
questions.explanation: Maximum intersection equals the smaller set.

questions.question: Which of the following is an infinite set?
options: Set of days in a week
questions.explanation: Even numbers continue endlessly.

questions.question: If A ‚äÇ B and B ‚äÇ A, then?
questions.explanation: Mutual subsets imply equality.

questions.question: Which set has exactly one element?
questions.explanation: A singleton has one element.

questions.question: Which formula applies to three sets A, B, and C?
questions.explanation: Three-set inclusion‚Äìexclusion applies.

questions.question: Which set operation is represented by shaded overlapping regions in Venn diagrams?
questions.explanation: Overlapping region shows intersection.

questions.question: If A ‚à™ B = U and A ‚à© B = ‚àÖ, then A and B are?
questions.explanation: They partition the universal set.

questions.question: Which of the following is always true?
questions.explanation: Union with empty set leaves A unchanged.

questions.question: If A has n elements, how many subsets contain a particular element?
questions.explanation: Half of all subsets contain a given element.

questions.question: Which operation gives elements in exactly one of the sets?
questions.explanation: Symmetric difference excludes common elements.

questions.question: If A = {1,2,3,4} and B = {3,4,5,6}, find A Œî B.
questions.explanation: Elements in either set but not both.

questions.question: Which law states A ‚à™ (B ‚à© C) = (A ‚à™ B) ‚à© (A ‚à™ C)?
questions.explanation: This is the distributive law.

questions.question: If A = U, then A‚Ä≤ is?
questions.explanation: Complement of universal set is empty.

questions.question: Which of the following best describes set theory?
questions.explanation: Set theory deals with collections.

questions.question: Why is set theory important in computer science?
options: It forms the basis of logic and data structures
questions.explanation: Set theory underpins logic, databases, and algorithms.
